title: How to write one million in numerical form - Quora

response.answer_text: How do I write one million in numerical form? That would depend on which Numerals;Numerical system; andNotational conventionyou were using. The most common answers would probably be: [math]1\,000\,000[/math][math]10^6[/math][math]10,00,000[/math]But numerals could be: Indo-Arabic [math]0-9[/math]Roman I,V,X,L,C,D,MMayanEtcNumerical systems include: DecimalBinaryRomanPrime factorsEtcNotational conventions include: Comma separators every 3 digitsPeriod separatorsScientific notationEtcSince the prime factors of one million are [math]\quad5^6\cdot2^6=5^{3\cdot2}\cdot2^{3\cdot2}[/math] we also have the representation of one million in Primal base as: [math]\quad\blacklozenge^{\blacklozenge\blacklozenge}\lozenge\blacklozenge^{\blacklozenge\blacklozenge}[/math] See my answer to What would an alternate numerical system look like? for details.

So this usually confuses everybody as to how many zeros are there in a million and  so on. The confusion arises because of different number systems.One million is basically TEN LAKHS in the Indian number system.So one million is followed by 6 zeros: 1,000,000 In the Indian number system it is written as: 10,00,000 Here's a quick reference to the number of zeros: Ten: 10 (1 zero)Hundred: 100 (2 zeros)Thousand: 1000 (3 zeros)Ten thousand 10,000 (4 zeros)Hundred thousand 100,000 (5 zeros)Million 1,000,000 (6 zeros)Billion 1,000,000,000 (9 zeros)Trillion 1,000,000,000,000 (12 zeros)Quadrillion 1,000,000,000,000,000 (15 zeros)Quintillion 1,000,000,000,000,000,000 (18 zeros)Sextillion 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 (21 zeros)Septillion 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 (24 zeros)Octillion 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 (27 zeros)Nonillion 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 (30 zeros)Decillion 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 (33 zeros)
